channel.title: Client - Messed up fonts
channel.description:
Usually the RSCA client (I haven't tried it with other clients) throws exceptions (ArrayIndexOutOfBounds) when loading fonts on Linux, if I catch the exception and keep calling it, the exception stops, but frequently some letters are messed up.
The error is occurring at GameImage.loadFont at this line: aByteArrayArray336[fontNumber][i1] = aByteArray351[i1];
I was thinking it might because the font isn't installed, but I don't have helvetica on Windows 7 and I don't get the error...
Does anyone know what causes this, or how to fix it?
Edit: Adding a delay of 500ms once there is an error seems to fix it... I synchronized access, and removed the delay, but that seems to have made it worse...

item.title: Client - Messed up fonts
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

RSCShadow:

[quote]that distortion is because the font is different between linux and windows

How is it different exactly? I took the font files from a Windows OS so I’m just curious.[/quote]
Did you actually add them so Java can use them, or just add them like you would for pretty much any other time?

Read full topic

item.title: Client - Messed up fonts
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

that distortion is because the font is different between linux and windows
How is it different exactly? I took the font files from a Windows OS so I'm just curious.

Read full topic

item.title: Client - Messed up fonts
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

super_:

well if you know then why don’t you tell us?

I think you’re confused… The question I’ve known the answer to for ages has already been answered, by you, and it was completely irrelevant to the OP…

I still don’t know why or what the error in the OP was caused by (which is the same issue as the pictures I just posted).

To be more clear:

This is not what the OP is about, and has already been answered sufficiently:

This is what I was talking about in the OP, has been ‘fixed’ (as in I can’t get it to happen again as the code stands), and I still have no clue what the actual cause was:

Read full topic

item.title: Client - Messed up fonts
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“gawdz666, post:27, topic:400448”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=497523.msg3666368#msg3666368 date=1310651590]
All of you are running it as a standalone application…

I’m running it as an applet, and I was getting distortions like this:

The top one is pretty uncommon (as in it’s much more messed up than usual). Usually the text has different font sizes, and odd characters (like in the second image).

I know why it look different on Linux, as in the images you guys posted, but I want to know what caused issues in these pictures… And why moving the point in which fonts were loaded until after the startGame method fixed it.
[/quote]
That is a bit weird i havent seen that im going to install linux on a vm and experiment with that.

Also Spaghetti[/quote]
You need to run it as an applet.

Read full topic

item.title: Client - Messed up fonts
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

super_:

we could probably fix it if you guys had better reports instead of just “they are messed up”

The original issue is that some letters were being replaced with really odd symbols, not showing up at all, or being the wrong size.

At this point, I’ve gotten that fixed (at least I think it is) but I want to know why it was doing that.

Now, it’s simply using the wrong font, I’m fairly certain it’s because the font isn’t installed.

Read full topic
